header.rec_loc: A room in the University, Salford
header.activity: Colleagues chatting in their coffee break
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, inquiring, anecdote telling, buying/selling

body.u: okay eh yes I have exciting news em you know we're buying a house?
eh well eh we put in an offer last week and it was rejected
it was on eh it was for which is kind of where we are now
eh and it was all very sad but we saw a house on Friday and it's eh it was a really good house em and so w we're kinda glad that that it fell through
and we eh we spoke to them this morning and put an offer in

and we started at ninety-eight em thousand which is a scary amount of money and em that was rejected but we knew it would be em and they came back and said well we think em that em basically going for about a hundred and two

so I said well why not put in an offer for a hundred and two and he came back and said em that em well no that's been rejected I'm afraid but em he did say that if em he'd accept a hundred and five so we've offered a hundred and five
but the worst part about it is that he's now in a meeting so
so we can't we can't we don't know for another half an hour so
yeah so it's em whether whether it's going to be accepted or not
so I'm going to get a phone call very shortly

so hopefully we'll have a house it's on on em which is in

just the thought of spending quite that much money

Cos you can see what it looks like and it's all pretty

because he might turn around and say no again eh so

until em until I can get some funds and then I will be moving out

it's which is such a shame because em the payments themselves are fine

both got full time jobs and they still can't manage it

for which is like ten times well not ten times that
but eh but you for for a lot more and em it's just crazy the the difference

em so em you can't argue with that
that's incredible my friend lives in Australia and she says similar stuff about that really the prices for like if you're buying foods and things is about the same
but houses are actually a lot cheaper out there apparently so I'll have to move out there
